summary: LawConnect: a subscription-based legal services SaaS where clients/businesses find verified lawyers, chat, and book consultations; lawyers subscribe to be listed, manage profiles/availability, receive leads, and handle bookings, with optional commission on consultations.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- LawConnect wordmark logo, modern legal aesthetic, light background (lawconnect-logo.dim_512x256.png)
- Homepage hero illustration, abstract legal/help theme, warm neutral palette (lawconnect-hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png)
- Simple lawyer avatar placeholder illustration, neutral tones (lawyer-avatar-placeholder.dim_512x512.png)
- Simple client avatar placeholder illustration, neutral tones (client-avatar-placeholder.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and an onboarding step that lets a logged-in user choose an account type (Client or Lawyer), then route them to the correct dashboard and permissions throughout the app.

Create the public marketing website pages and sections for LawConnect: Homepage with hero + CTAs (“Find a Lawyer”, “Join as a Lawyer”), How It Works (3 steps), subscription plans preview (client + lawyer), testimonials section (static seed data), a “For Businesses” section, and a final CTA section.

Implement a coherent, distinctive visual theme for LawConnect and apply it consistently across marketing pages, directory, profiles, and dashboards (colors, typography, spacing, component styles). Avoid a blue/purple dominant palette.

Build the “Find a Lawyer” directory page with filters (practice area, location, experience level, language, rating, availability: Today/This Week) and a lawyer card UI that shows profile photo, years of experience, specialization, consultation fee, an availability indicator/button, and a “Subscribe & Book” CTA linking into the booking flow.

Implement verified lawyer profiles with: bio, credentials, areas of expertise, reviews, consultation fee, and a list of available time slots; include CTAs to book a consultation and to subscribe for ongoing support.
Implement the consultation booking system: lawyers can define availability slots; clients can pick a slot, create a booking, and see booking status. Prevent double-booking of the same slot.
Implement in-app 1:1 messaging between a client and a lawyer that is scoped to a relationship created by a booking (or an explicit client-lawyer connection) and is accessible from both dashboards.

Implement client subscription plans and entitlements: Starter (GHC 99/month), Professional (GHC 299/month), Business (GHC 899/month), including subscription management UI and enforcement of consultation quotas/benefits where applicable.

Implement lawyer subscription plans: Basic (GHC 199/month) and Pro (GHC 499/month), including subscription management, featured listing/priority placement flags for Pro, and a minimal analytics view for lawyers.

Add payment record tracking for subscriptions and consultations, including a Payment History view in the client dashboard and earnings summary in the lawyer dashboard. Use an in-app “recorded payment” flow (no external processor integration) with clear statuses (pending/paid/refunded).

Implement client dashboard features: upcoming consultations, chat access, payment history, subscription management, document vault (upload/store/download files as frontend-only attachments metadata or small text documents), and saved lawyers.
Implement lawyer dashboard features: booking calendar, client messages, earnings summary, availability settings, reviews view, and subscription upgrade controls.
Add a reviews system: clients can leave a rating and written review for a lawyer after a completed consultation; ratings contribute to the lawyer’s displayed rating and directory filter.

Seed the backend with example lawyers (with practice areas, locations, languages, experience, fees, sample availability) so the directory and profile pages are usable without manual data entry, and provide a minimal “Join as a Lawyer” flow that creates a lawyer profile for the logged-in lawyer account.
Add static generated brand assets (logo and simple UI illustrations) and render them from the frontend as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated.

new_feature_requests.summary: Client subscription plans (Starter/Professional/Business) with billing, plan limits/entitlements, and subscription management
Lawyer subscription plans (Basic/Pro) including featured listing upgrade, priority placement, analytics, and lead notifications
Lawyer directory with filters (practice area, location, experience, language, rating, availability) and lawyer cards
Verified lawyer profiles (bio, credentials, expertise, reviews, consultation fee, available time slots) with CTAs to book/subscribe
Consultation booking system with availability/calendar and scheduling flow
In-app chat/messaging between clients and lawyers
Client dashboard: upcoming consultations, chat, payment history, subscription management, document vault, saved lawyers
Lawyer dashboard: booking calendar, client messages, earnings summary, availability settings, reviews, subscription upgrades
Payments support for consultations and subscription billing; optional commission (10–20%) on paid consultations
Marketing/public website pages: homepage sections (hero, how-it-works, plan previews, testimonials, business section) and key CTAs
Support an optional commission model on paid consultations with a configurable commission rate between 10% and 20%, and reflect commission deductions in the lawyer earnings summary.
